meanings.definition: A young salmon or trout undergoing the process of smoltification.
meanings.sent1: The smolt swam gracefully in the river.
meanings.sent2: I saw a smolt jumping out of the water.
meanings.sent3: The smolt wore a tiny crown made of seaweed.
meanings.sent4: The smolt's silver scales shimmered like stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The little smolt danced in the sunlight, a shimmering jewel in the water.

meanings.sent1: The caterpillar will smolt into a beautiful butterfly.
meanings.sent2: She watched the tadpole smolt into a young frog.
meanings.sent3: The old car magically smolted into a shiny new sports car.
meanings.sent4: His dream was to smolt into a successful entrepreneur.
meanings.sent5: The seeds will smolt into vibrant flowers in the spring.

meanings.definition: The stage in the life cycle of a salmon or trout when it becomes a smolt.
meanings.sent1: During the smolt stage, the fish develop distinct markings.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen eagerly await the arrival of the smolt season.
meanings.sent3: The smolt party in the river was the highlight of the year.
meanings.sent4: The river was teeming with smolt, a sign of a healthy ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The smolt migration was a sight to behold, a silver river flowing through the forest.
